remarks: The supremum of a bounded set of real numbers is an upper bound. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 20-May-2019.)
statement:
supicc.1 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
supicc.2 $e |- ( ph -> C e. RR ) $.
supicc.3 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ ( B [,] C ) ) $.
supicc.4 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= (/) ) $.
supiccub.1 $e |- ( ph -> D e. A ) $.
supiccub $p |- ( ph -> D <_ sup ( A , RR , < ) ) $.
